Temperature: 37.6°C, Blood Pressure: 120/76 mmHg, Pulse: 80 bpm, Weight: 80.3 kg
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: 1+ pitting edema of the legs to the knees, remainder of examination normal

Headache reported as pulsating in quality, nausea without vomiting, severe jaw pain on chewing; cranial nerves and motor/sensory functions normal; neck supple; temporal arteries tor -tious, enlarged, nontender.
Normal vital signs, neck supple, temporal arteries tortuous, enlarged, nontender, pupils equal and reactive, visual acuity 20/20, fundus examination normal.
Lymphocytosis and elevated protein level on lumbar puncture; biopsy of right temporal artery revealed mild intimal hyperplasia.
Pathological examination of the temporal artery biopsy revealed mild intimal hyperplasia and no evidence of giant-cell arteritis.
MRI showed extension of dural thickening and enhancement to the sella with nodular enhancement of the pituitary stalk.
